bow: food for toddler with allergies hi all need help trying to figure out what to feed my year old baby with food allergies she was tested positive for peanut dairy and egg whites allergy we have gotten her tested for tree nuts but it possible she might be allergic still breastfeed her and ve been trying to introduce her to other kinds of milk tried almond milk and she rejected it so assumed maybe it was making her mouth itchy or something trying soy milk right now but she only takes few sips and as soon as she finds out what in the bottle she stops drinking next on my list is to try rice or coconut milk has any of you had success as for solids she is getting bored of the same food being offered mostly give her fruits veggies chicken tofu and rice ve given her egg free pasta and she does eat it she also rejected oatmeal really need suggestions on some other foods can give to her please help will be forever grateful try cocoa wheats still love them to this day and was absoloutly in love when was little it considered hot cereal idk how you get your groceries but that around the isle area it would be also recommend trying to find vegan foods sense they wo have milk or egg in them like vegan baby toddler foods or graham crackers and other such foods thanks so much ll give them try my 1yo has the same allergies except he allergic to all of the egg and it challenge finding foods for him some days he loves spaghetti chili any kind of chicken toast with almond butter or soy butter but there other varieties out there too ravioli whole foods has vegan ravioli happy baby makes squash ravioli that allergen free too we don rely on milk substitute but we do occasionally give him bolthouse dairy free milk it pea protein milk like ripple we also give him ripple yogurt also if you re ever out and about and needing to grab dinner somewhere chick fil has kid meal with grilled nuggets and fruit that completely allergen free when we switched from formula to regular milk also when switching from breast milk to formula we did it gradually would mix of breast milk to of whatever milk you decide to try then gradually increase the milk over couple weeks with the allergies would check with your pediatrician to see what kind of milk they recommend also at one would try feeding her whatever you are eating as long as it doesn contain allergens my son decided around that time that he was done with baby food and only wanted to eat what we were eating we eat fairly healthy so it was actually just easier to not fix him special meals and just carefully cut up serving of what we were eating for him agree the switch of milk is tough one for lots of kids that great idea had thought of it thank you this is just what was looking for thank you we only tested her for egg whites because we could only test for things at time but suspect she is allergic to egg yolks too yes hoping that how it would be we have started to do this but when she is teething she does want to chew and wants softer food like mashed potatoes and tofu etc will keep offering her adult foods thanks my son is allergic to dairy find with soy it matter of brand some of them make your mouth feel claggy like sticky it usually the more expensive ones strangely enough make sure you buy ones that have added vitamins by the way whichever brand you go with also do get the unsweetened ones cows milk is naturally sweet like breast milk it why babies love them coconut milk is big success as are rice and oat milk again do go for unsweetened you can buy vegan cheeses vegan parmesan is great success with my toddler on pasta but generally find the vegan cheddars are great you can buy soya yoghurts and coconut milk yogurts my son loves both add some fruit puree if you ca find flavoured one you can buy soya cream to use in cooking and rice whip like squirty cream to use on puds go somewhere that makes pizzas up for you and check that their base does have dairy just ask them to make one without cheese buy few and freeze them loads of dairy free ice cream and chocolate nowadays are you based in england or ireland by any chance and can point you to some brands and likely places to buy them thank you so much in the us this is new to me and had no idea there are products like soya yogurts we live in small college town and have seen them in the grocery stores go to but maybe more upscale or speciality store might carry them try banza pasta it cooks up little faster but is made from chickpeas and tastes pretty good ve heard many say ripple milk worked well for them oh wish had done this never thought of that my sone would not drink regular milk his pediatrician said just give it at every meal until he drinks it but that never happened this would have been so much better amp x200b just seen you posted your moving to or have moved to connecticut if you have wegmans in the area they usually have really great selection of non dairy and vegan friendly items thanks ll try that pasta would be great addition since she relying mostly on rice and potatoes for carbs awesome thanks will give it try my sone is allergic to dairy egg all nuts and fish when he was year old we gave him hemp milk as source of calcium now at he drinks coconut milk as for food he eats rice pasta barley with veggies and meats loves sheppard pie with no cheese or egg here is good recipe for sweet potato bites http aneverydayblessing com 2013 03 12 sweet potato bites for baby we used this banana bread recipe for his birthday cake https www justapinch com recipes bread sweet bread no eggs no milk no problem banana html later we found that he does react to goat milk powder so use it in pancake recipes for him it tough to feed kid with allergies hope they will outgrow it some day did you know that almost all modern edible seedless parthenocarp bananas come from two wild species *musa acuminata* and *musa balbisiana* the old scientific name for banana *musa sapientum* which means fruit of the wise men is no longer used *** ^^i amp 32 amp 32 bot amp 32 *bleep* amp 32 *bloop* amp 32 amp 32 amp 32 **unsubscribe** https np reddit com message compose to=bananafactbot amp subject=i 20hate 20potassium amp message=if 20you 20would 20like 20to 20unsubscribe 20from 20banana 20facts 2c 20send 20this 20private 20message 20with 20the 20subject 20 27i 20hate 20potassium 27 20 amp 32 amp 32 **🍌** https np reddit com bananafactbot comments 8acmq6 banana st=jfof9k8d amp sh=acd80944 my husband work offered him promotion and matching salary so we ended up staying in georgia so no wegmans for me but thank you will say that both times tried chik fila with my little grilled nuggets and fries and lemonade are all supposed to be df he had reaction each time asked for glove change and he doesn have cc issues but would say be weary because we ve been dairied twice there keep an eye out they are making their way south thank you she liked sweet potatoes puree so sure this will be great hit sure hope they outgrow their allergies good luck to us all that so weird my son allergy to dairy is really severe but we ve never had any issues it always worries me getting something from restaurant though some employees just don food allergies seriously if she has peanut allergy and potentially tree nut allergy stay away from soy and other nut milks even if she not highly allergic she could have sensitivity that may only show up after repeated exposure soy beans chickpeas etc are all legumes and in the peanut family try oat milk thanks that why hesitant and do want to push her to take almond milk and soy milk will be trying rice milk and coconut milk my little hated oatmeal until added cinnamon and nutmeg if you like to use spice on your food your little one is used to tasting it in utero and in bm try some foods again with some flavor treat spice like new food in case of allergies and avoid salt and sugar otherwise garlic onion powder black pepper cinnamon nutmeg etc super tasty good luck oat milk sounds like good alternative thanks ripple is my suggestion too probably mixed with breastmilk at first too my daughter only had dairy issue and we gave her the silk almond and cashew with pea protein milk for awhile but assuming you will stay away from other nuts not sure how peanut allergies work sorry my friends daughter did have reaction to the ripple and now they get flaxseed milk believe the brand good karma is in the refrigerated section for that thanks like to use spices in my cooking so that could be the reason she does like the plain oatmeal ve given her will start adding spices to her food thinking of staying away from other nuts until we get her tested thanks for the suggestion ve been seeing good things about flexseed but have yet to try it ll give it try will have to be careful thanks for the heads up worry about the same thing and always have to pack some food for her it hard since she ca talk and ca tell whether she is in pain just tired or overstimulated hopefully once she knows how to talk and communicate better we might be able to enjoy eating out more it was lifesaver for us he would barely eat anything and then thought he loved the flavor ofgripewater probably because of my chai habit while pregnant and click hope it works for you sorry if this is poorly typed doing talk to text while holding sick kid thanks hope the little one feels better soon at one my little had peanut egg soy wheat dairy oat pumpkin squash and oat allergies we did zero processed food and it was challenge we did lot of vegan cooking and learned how to do fun things with fruit and veggies our nutritionist said if my lo didn take to milk alternatives to cut it out as it not super necessary in their diets so we got protein from broccoli etc we did things like banana pancakes made from bananas not flour and such vegan muffins etc ill add more to this when get home though and give you some ideas thanks we re gon na get her tested for other allergies as well it is challenge even now ca imagine having to deal with more allergies love to know your recipes looking forward to it if she ends up being allergic to soy the ripple milk may also cause problems my son also could have any peas pea protein etc just keep it in mind as possibility look up the asl sign for tummy ache or itchy or whatever their symptom is by they should be able to master it pretty effectively everytime you mention it to the sign will say it single location ve tried twice and it up in the ne where feel like the cfa game is weaker than down south we do oat milk and hemp milk the hemp is super nutritious and the oat is sweet and really tasty do half and half when she is refusing plain hemp some days she just does love it others she does she does have any reaction to tofu and peas and actually enjoys eating them so hoping it wo cause her any discomfort thank you better safe than sorry yes we re teaching her to sign more now she can say few words like mama dada etc hopefully we can move on to other signs and simple words to show discomfort thanks have thought of doing half and half for the little one until someone else mentioned it earlier it seems to be great solution will try oat milk and hemp milk and combination of all sorts of milk haha thanks have you tried silk soy yogurt find it better option than soy milk we also stick to some gf pastas as they re egg free and my kid loves the texture so we use ronzoni gf no egg in facilities at all vans makes gf waffle that is egg free as well their regular waffles have egg and he likes those along with their gf pancakes freedom cereals are good and my kid will use soy milk or rice milk with cereal hash browns are also big hit here along with french fries and burger patties just the patty lightly salted or no salt sausage and bacon are favorites of his as well you learn to work around it also if you need to make cake use the soda method one box of cake mix can of coke mix bake so easy like hemp milk my kiddo doesn have any allergies but she loved eating sliced olives at that age when mention it most people act like they never thought to give their kid olives the nice thing about them is that they re high in fat so you get decent calorie bang for your buck with them and it can be hard to find fat sources for little ones when you re avoiding nuts and dairy adding to this about ripple milk it is pea protein based so you won need to worry about but allergens it also has more protein than almond milk if you want to you can try pureeing adult foods it will have more calories than the actual purée foods like beechnut or gerber it might be worth try wishing you the best not sure how they test babies but if it skin panel check that your daughter does have skin condition have atopic dermatitis and everyone thought had bad food allergies for years because my skin reacts to the needle scratch if it blood test disregard my comments sorbet was my treat when was kid and we thought was allergic to milk and still love the stuff looking back never felt that weird about it because my parents made it seem like was getting treat when had to eat something different than everyone else they never made big deal about it and also made sure knew the things was allergic to and was reading labels early was empowered about it if you have questions about what it like growing up with allergies let me know thank you so much it great to hear feedback from someone with food allergies my baby has eczema and it was pretty bad that we had to put her on oral steroids for few days when she was months old it still flares up whenever she is exposed to her allergens or when she spends some time under the sun we re good about keeping it under control most of the time with oinments normally babies are given the skin prick test but this time we ended up getting blood test for her we might get skin prick tests in the future it great idea to turn her foods into treat and to educate her at young age will be sure to do the same she still so young so can supervise what she eats but worry about her being at playdates sleepovers where adult supervision is somewhat limited growing up do you remember being in situation where you had to explain other kids about your allergies understand as you get older other kids will be more knowledgeable about these kinds of things but how can little kids understand not everyone eat the same things also do want her to feel left out at birthday parties etc did you ever feel like you were missing out thanks if were you ask her allergist to run full nut panel to make it easier to figure out what your toddler can eat my son had allergic reactions to peanuts and eggs when we ran the nut panel we also found out he was allergic to cashews and pistachios too but fine with all the other nuts my son eats fair amount of almond butter which is nice way to sneak some protein in him before he got picky he would also allow us to feed him tofu so that might be another option yes what great idea she refuses fruit and veggie purees but she might like the more flavorful pureed adult food thanks that awesome now realizing that there are many nutritious foods that babies can eat never would have thought of it before thanks this is great thanks was pretty bummed that could give my little one pancakes or waffles she loves harsh browns and anything made of potatoes have tried bacon but ca wait to see her face when she gets to eat it haha yes we ll be testing for all nuts at the next appointment she loves tofu so that what ve been giving her for now thanks are you guys open to eating other meat proteins salmon chopped up shrimp stewed beef stewed pork etc remember feeling left out when kids would bring something in for birthdays and could have it early on think teachers and other parents helped out sure my mom told lots of people early on most adults react really well when you say no mayo have an allergy and your child will mirror you as for other kids mom my says ca have that is pretty standard after certain age knew it could kill me which is not the scary to kids if you re not scared when you tell it think was told you have food allergies lots of people have them and if you eat these things your body will react these are the symptoms to look for it very important to tell an adult if you start feeling any of them you will not get in trouble it means you need to go to the hospital to get better also had great doctors who impressed on me how serious this was and ended up with sticker or little toy at the end so never minded doctors think there was lot of if you feel bad doctors make you feel better it was more about these are just the facts we re moving forward with that knowledge it not big deal remember everyone in the family getting pizza and got whatever wanted on personal pan pizza my brother had to share what my parents wanted that was what good substitution was like at home if was eating what everyone else was got to pick it what got will add highly recommend you try and see specialist dermatologist did know until was in high school that was allergic to dairy did know until the specialist saw to get on new medication off handedly mentioned it hope this helps might have rambled on bit my son had* the same allergies we did lot of kielbasa sausage which he loves the snack safely guide https snacksafely com safe snack guide gives lot of great ideas about snacks that you can use be aware of brand differences for instance rold gold pretzels are safe but snyder are not because they use the same line to manufacture pb stuffed pretzels and are subject to cross contamination the food allergy research and education fare https www foodallergy org life with food allergies newly diagnosed has lot of great resources as well for getting used to life with food allergies and how to educate others about your child allergies wowbutter or sunbutter are great peanut butter substitutes chex cheerios life cereals are favorites red robbins has great app that will help you customize any of your meals to make sure they are compliant with her needs tell your server you have allergies at the table they take it very seriously there and it was the only place we felt safe going to for long time *note* say had the same allergies because after his 2nd birthday we took him in for re test had to consume the allergens over the course of hours in the allergist office while being monitored and he tested clear of all allergens he now and can eat whatever he willing to put in his mouth good luck it must be incredibly stressful to have baby with allergies hang in there depending on age just tear it into bite sized pieces and it hit for us thank you for the resources and pointing out the differences in brands will be sure to keep an eye out my baby loves cheerios will try the other ones so happy to hear that your son outgrew his allergies what lucky guy understand some kids do but it makes me feel better knowing that there is possibility my baby might outgrow her allergies too yes we have given her salmon pork and some turkey for thanksgiving have tried shrimp for fear of shellfish allergy my husband and love seafood and it would really suck if she has seafood allergy she did show any reaction to salmon so hoping she ll be okay with shellfish brands and food recalls are huge the year before my son allergies came up there was cumin recall for peanuts ground into some of the batches had to clear the cupboards of cumin to make sure what we had was safe my rule when had others watch him was that he was only to eat food provided to ensure anything he was eating was safe it very overwhelming at first but you get into the swing of it my daughter sees dermatologist and that how we found out she has eczema we have regular check up so will discuss her allergy test results with the dermatologist next time we go ca thank you enough for going into details your parents did great job raising you and educating you about your allergies commend them and wish to become great parent like them one day my baby was exposed to peanut while we were at playdate at neighbor house and we had to home to give her some benadryl now we carry around bottle of benadryl and epipen in her diaper bag it is very overwhelming but after reading all the comments feel like we can get through this thanks again for the tips there daniel tiger episode about food allergies he finds out he allergic to peaches if you haven started tv yet this is the best show for toddlers mr rogers based show and kids like it but it also has excellent skill building and parent tips wrapped in most of it is free on amazon prime you can google to find out which episode it is but it in the amazon season or or so thank you so much have amazon prime so it perfect sounds like you re good then you re doing great job thank you
